main event: On August 6, 1952, multiple witnesses reported observing bright lights in the sky over Baltimore, Maryland, including a pilot who saw 11 bright lights forming a pattern.
interesting points: The pilot was experienced with over 2,000 hours of flying time and was considered a reliable observer., Visual observations were corroborated by radar data from Baltimore-Washington International Airport., The observed objects accelerated to estimated speeds of up to 2,000 mph, beyond the capabilities of known aircraft., Several adults reported seeing a bright flash of light moving at high speed and climbing in altitude., The sightings occurred around a time when there were no conventional explanations for the observed phenomena.
